name: Crypto-mimetic : Fly Agaric
description:
(2021)
By ClockworkFeathers

Seed beads over recycled aluminum, photographed on moss and ferns.

Binomial name: Amanita muscaria 

Possibly the most iconic fungal fruiting body, the signature red cap with white spots is widely found in forests, forming symbiotic relationships with trees, across the northern hemisphere.

Fungi are the great recyclers, taking material that has been discarded and breaking them down into something that can be more easily and readily used by them and by others. This mimic takes up that spirit by building upon the bottom of an aluminum can as a form for its cap.

Symbolically, the fly agaric is a gateway; it has been known to alter one’s perceptions, which is what working with the blockchain has done for me. It seems fitting for me to use it as a subject my experiments with making art for the blockchain.

One of the themes that I explore in my work is mimicking other objects in other mediums, and in thinking about how to format that into something that can be minted, I decided to compose the mimic into an environment that the objects being mimicked are found.
